settings.heading: Immunity Building Oxymel
settings.text: Fire Cider is a Fall/Winter staple in our herbal medicine cabinet. We take it at the first signs of a cold or as a daily immune-boosting supplement.

settings.custom-liquid: <iframe width="320" height="522" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gyZejX30-5E" title="Fire Cider Oxymel" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

settings.heading: Ingredients
settings.description:
2-3 C Apple Cider Vinegar
1 C Honey
Garlic Cloves
Ginger
Turmeric
Peppercorn
Jalapeno
Horseradish
Pantry Herbs (Rosemary, Thyme, Oregano)
Medicinal Herbs (Astragalus, Ashwaghandha, Reishi, Lion's Mane)

settings.heading: Instructions
settings.description:
Chop or Blend your ingredients.

In a dry, clean 32oz mason jar, fill to the top with your ingredients.

Add apple cider vinegar and honey in a 3:1 ratio (you can also choose a ratio of up to 1:1). 

Cover with parchment paper and then mason jar lid. The parchment paper will prevent corrosion of your lid.

Store for 4-6 weeks in a cool, dry place like a kitchen cabinet. 

Strain and use this immunity building oxymel when feeling under the weather (1-2 tbsp) or as a daily shot, as salad dressing, even as a marinade!
